poem:
**In the Morning's Headlines**  

Trump, a thundering storm in the morning news,  
seeking loyalty like ancient kings,  
while whispers of distant labour stir the air—  
A tea kettle hums softly  
as I sip and watch,  
pondering the delicate balance  
between unchecked power and quiet resistance,  
a dance played out  
on ink-stained pages  
and in the silence of another dawn.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Harris accuses Trump of wanting ‘unchecked power’ and personal loyalty from military after retired US army officers raise alarm – live 6.50pm BST Donald Trump has furiously accused the UK’s Labour party of interfering in the US election, calling it ‘far left’, after party activists travelled to campaign for his opponent. The Guardian’s Jonathan Freedland and Michael Safi report: Related: US election extra: Trump accuses Labour of ‘interference’ – podcast 6.39pm BST Walz on his". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Harris accuses Trump of wanting ‘unchecked power’ and personal loyalty from military after retired US army officers raise alarm – live 6.50pm BST Donald Trump has furiously accused the UK’s Labour party of interfering in the US election, calling it ‘far left’, after party activists travelled to campaign for his opponent. The Guardian’s Jonathan Freedland and Michael Safi report: Related: US election extra: Trump accuses Labour of ‘interference’ – podcast 6.39pm BST Walz on his
